response:
The combination of inflammatory-pattern back pain, fever (38.0°C), and acute neurological deficit is highly suggestive of an infectious process affecting the spine. Spinal epidural abscess is the most critical diagnosis to exclude. The background history suggests undiagnosed spondyloarthropathy (e.g., Ankylosing Spondylitis), which increases susceptibility to infections, fractures, and inflammation.

differential_diagnosis = ["Spinal Epidural Abscess", "Vertebral Osteomyelitis/Discitis", "Transverse Myelitis", "Spinal Cord Metastasis", "Spinal Epidural Haematoma", "Ankylosing Spondylitis-associated Vertebral Fracture"]
